intro: Achyronia divaricata, commonly known as the variable achyronia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
